about.name: Monaco
about.info_text: Monaco is a tiny yet glamorous principality located on the French Riviera in Western Europe. Known for its opulent lifestyle, luxurious casinos, and stunning Mediterranean coastline, Monaco is a playground for the rich and famous. Visitors can explore its charming old town, visit the iconic Casino de Monte-Carlo, or enjoy the vibrant nightlife and cultural events. Despite its small size, Monaco boasts a rich history and a unique blend of French and Mediterranean influences.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 38,000
Country: Monaco
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: French
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Monaco, situated on the French Riviera, enjoys a Mediterranean climate characterized by mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers. Summer temperatures in Monaco can reach 30°C to 35°C (86°F to 95°F), while winter temperatures generally range from 8°C to 14°C (46°F to 57°F). Precipitation is more frequent in the cooler months, with drier conditions prevailing during the summer.

attractions_card.title: Casino de Monte-Carlo
attractions_card.description: One of the world's most iconic casinos, the Casino de Monte-Carlo offers a glamorous gaming experience in a stunning Belle Époque building.

attractions_card.title: Prince's Palace of Monaco
attractions_card.description: Visit the official residence of the Sovereign Prince of Monaco. Explore the palace's historical and architectural treasures.

attractions_card.title: The Rock of Monaco
attractions_card.description: Perched on a rocky outcrop, The Rock is home to Monaco-Ville, the old town. Stroll through charming streets and enjoy panoramic views.

attractions_card.title: Oceanographic Museum
attractions_card.description: Discover marine life and oceanography at this fascinating museum, founded by Prince Albert I. It features an impressive aquarium and educational exhibits.

food_card.title: Bouillabaisse
food_card.description: Savor the flavors of the Mediterranean with bouillabaisse, a traditional fish stew. Monaco's coastal location offers some of the freshest seafood dishes.

food_card.title: Barbagiuan
food_card.description: Try barbagiuan, a savory pastry filled with Swiss chard, ricotta, and Parmesan. It's a popular local snack.

food_card.title: Tarte aux Noix
food_card.description: Indulge in tarte aux noix, a delicious walnut pie that's a sweet treat and a favorite dessert in Monaco.

hotels_card.title: Hotel de Paris Monte-Carlo
hotels_card.description: Experience luxury at its finest at Hotel de Paris. This iconic hotel offers exquisite rooms, Michelin-starred dining, and a prime location.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Hermitage Monte-Carlo
hotels_card.description: A Belle Époque gem, Hotel Hermitage boasts elegance and modern comforts. Guests can enjoy stunning views and access to the casino.

hotels_card.title: Fairmont Monte Carlo
hotels_card.description: Set by the sea, the Fairmont Monte Carlo offers luxurious rooms and amenities, including a rooftop pool and fitness center.

transport_card.title: Monaco Heliport
transport_card.description: Arrive in style by taking a helicopter from Nice Côte d'Azur Airport. The heliport offers breathtaking views of the French Riviera.

transport_card.title: Public Transport
transport_card.description: Monaco's efficient bus network provides an easy way to get around the principality and explore its attractions and neighborhoods.
